seo.title: Build contextual editing into your site
seo.description: Open-source visual editing experience, backed by git.

items.headline: Customize the Editing UI
items.text: Take full control of the editing UI by providing custom components in Tina’s schema.

items.headline: Site Building
items.text: Create reusable components that you can edit with Tina. Give your editors the ability to assemble pages like a custom built site-builder.

items.headline: GraphQL Data Layer
items.text: Query your Markdown content like you would a database. Tina’s GraphQL Data Layer supports filtering, sorting, pagination, and more.

items.headline: Static or Server Side Rendering
items.text: Power your SSR and ISR sites with Markdown content when you use the GraphQL Data Layer.

items.headline: Develop Locally
items.text: In development, run Tina locally and talk to your local filesystem. This makes making changes to your schema a breeze.

items.headline: Integrate 3rd-party Media
items.text: If you don’t wish to store media in your repo, connect to S3, Cloudinary, etc.

items.headline: MDX, Markdown, JSON
items.text: Tina support open-formats, in your repo.

items.headline: Markdown at Scale
items.text: There is no limit to what you can do with Markdown when combined with a data layer.  Tina powers 10’s of thousands of pages for Smashing Magazine with great performance and without GitHub rate-limiting.

items.headline: No database, no sync issues
items.text: In development, run Tina locally and talk to your local filesystem. This makes making changes to your schema a breeze.
